intro: Jurinea suidunensis, commonly known as the Suidun sandflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually small, hairy, and arranged in a rosette to reduce water loss. Jurinea suidunensis is often found in desert steppes and is an important component of the local flora.
